fields.headline: Correct procedures
fields.bodyText: If Diane Taylor had contacted us before writing her story (UK Border Agency investigation finds cause for 'significant concern', 9 August), we could have explained what we advised our members to do in relation to the investigation and that we do not believe we hindered it, as Ms Perrett alleges. We simply advised members to seek advice from their union and get representation before agreeing to go into any meetings. This is standard practice and helps ensure that the correct procedures are being followed and that staff are not put under undue pressure. We are committed to ensuring UKBA – in common with all the departments, agencies and organisations where our members work – enforce their legal duties to promote equality. Nobody has done more than PCS to push the equality agenda with civil service employers, and we will continue to press for improvements. Paul O'Connor Negotiations officer, Public and Commercial Services union
